info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 9:35AM EDT until May 31 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Albany NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southern Vermont, including the following county, Windham.
* WHEN...Until 1145 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 935 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brattleboro, Townshend, Putney, Vernon, Saxtons River, Westminster, Newfane, Guilford Center, Guilford, Marlboro, Halifax, Brookline, Athens, North Westminster, Jacksonville, Williamsville Station, West Dummerston, Williamsville, Dummerston Center and Naulahka. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report flooding to the National Weather Service by email at ALB.stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM EDT THIS MORNING
